intro: Pouzolzia conulifera, commonly known as the coastal pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dune environments. Pouzolzia conulifera plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
